_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: This plant is operated and maintained using good engineering practices.
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Ammonia feed pump, transfer hoses, block valves, and mass flow meter.
_prev_prog_2.Description: Ammonia is not stored on-site on a full time basis.  It is brought onto the site in a 11,200 gallon capacity trailer which is set up as a feed tank for a portable pipe reactor.  No maintenance or prevention program is required by the plant during the time when the ammonia is off-site.  The prevention program for the Hastings plant is directed at the operation of setting up the portable ammonia tank, filling it, and removing it after the operation is completed.  This is done using visual inspections during operation and a set of standard operating methods for hooking up and for transporting the portable tank.  The major prevention program duringthe operation is directed at the operation of the portable reactor which is covered under PSM regulations.  The RMP for the Hastings facility meshes with the PSM of the reactor to provide the appropriate regulatroy coverage during the operations.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  FACILITY POLICY.

The owners, management, and employees of Blick's, Inc. are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Adams County LEPC or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.  

2. FACILITY INFORMATION.  

The primary activity of the facility is the storage and blending of fertilizers for wholesale purposes.  Anhydrous ammonia is not normally stored on site.  It is received and stored on- site on a  temporary basis for use only by a portable pipe reactor that visits the facility periodically.  The ammonia is stored in an ammonia tanker trailer that has been disconnected and set up a temporary feed tank and as a receiver for make-up ammonia as needed.  The portable pipe reactor is covered under OSHA'S PSM and it maintains its documentation.  This documentation is blended with the site RMP information to meet the overall requlatory requirements for this operation.  The maximum quantity ever stored on-site is 42,000 pounds (approximately 9,000 gallons).  The tank is refilled using tanker trucks as needed.  During the downtime between operation of the portable reactor, the tanker trailer/feed tank is removed from the site.  

3.WORST-CASE SCENARIO AND THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO.  

The worst-case scenario would be the release of the total contents of the tanker trailer/feed tank.  this could result in the release of up to 42,000# of liquid ammonia over a 10 minute period.  The distance to the end point (point of dispersion to 200 ppm) is 3.6 miles.  The alternative release scenario, based on the most likely potential incident, is the rupture of an ammonia feed hose that is being used to transfer liquid ammonia from the feed pump to the portable reactor.  This could result in an ammonia release of about 200 #/minute over a 5 minute period.  The distance to the end point i

s 0.2 miles.  

4.  ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", publidhed by the American Health Standards Institute, Inc.  Equipment inspection prior to use is emphasized.  

5.  FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.  

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the last five years at the facility; and to our knowledge no off-site consequences reported.  

6.  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.  

The facility has a written emergency response plan and has provided the state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title lll. 

7.  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.  

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic reviews are performed to assess the maintenance and operations to establish safe operating conditions.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
